sub_title: Product Manager with Entrepreneurial Mindset｜MBA at TIAS
summary:
“Efficient, Flexible, and adaptable” would be the three main words that describe me. I’m a person full of curiosity about people and cultures. I love to solve problems and have always been drawn to new challenges. Achieving my personal and work target always brings me the greatest joy.

I have built my career in🔹product management and🔹business management during the past 8 years throughout East Asia. My strong language abilities in English, Chinese, Korean, and Japanese have been a powerful skill set, enabling me to build bridges between cross-functioning teams to achieve sales goals. With a lot of practical experience, I’m proficient with brand distribution and product management in sales and marketing.

I am also honored to have had the opportunity to participate in several intrapreneurship projects at a large international corporation, giving me insight into entrepreneurship and market management.

✅𝙒𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙄’𝙢 𝙘𝙖𝙥𝙖𝙗𝙡𝙚 𝙤𝙛?. Digital Product Management (SaaS, E-commerce), Data Analysis.  Cross-cultural negotiation and business management. Business consultancy. Market strategy. Business level for English, Chinese, Korean, and Japanese. 

🎯𝙒𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙄’𝙢 𝙡𝙤𝙤𝙠𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙛𝙤𝙧?A challenging job that requires solid experience in product management. I’m also exploring the possibilities of incubating my own business ideas.

💬 𝘐’𝘮 𝘪𝘯𝘵𝘦𝘳𝘦𝘴𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘵𝘰 𝘩𝘦𝘢𝘳 𝘢𝘭𝘭 𝘬𝘪𝘯𝘥𝘴 𝘰𝘧 𝘴𝘵𝘰𝘳𝘪𝘦𝘴 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘭𝘦𝘢𝘳𝘯 𝘢𝘣𝘰𝘶𝘵 𝘯𝘦𝘸 𝘤𝘩𝘢𝘭𝘭𝘦𝘯𝘨𝘦𝘴! 𝘓𝘦𝘵’𝘴 𝘤𝘰𝘯𝘯𝘦𝘤𝘵!
Chloe.huang900@gmail.com

𝗖𝗵𝗲𝗰𝗸𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝗺𝘆 𝗯𝗹𝗼𝗴:
tzling.com  (English version is on!)

💻 𝗙𝗶𝗻𝗱 𝗮 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝗰𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸: (Website I built for remote workers around the world)
cafeandcowork.com

● Certificate: Google Data analytics (SQL,R, data cleaning)

▪️Define Problem and Build - Recognized and addressed the issue of rental supply shortage, conducting a thorough analysis of the gap
between existing service providers like Pararius and Funda, and the needs of consumers. Utilizing competitor analysis and user interviews, I defined the product scope as instant email notifications, catering to user preferences, and designed the revenue streams.
▪️Measure Learn (Current Stage) - After six months of operation, I was able to identify improvements and are now redefining the product scope and feature roadmap. By leveraging positive market analysis, my team and I are devising a new pricing model to capitalize on the upcoming graduation season and further evaluating the current usability of the product.

💐OnTally - Create Your Own Reward System (ontally.com)
Managed a business consultancy project focused on expanding the customer base and enhancing product visibility. Conducted user
questionnaires and market research to gather insights, allowing for prioritization of future feature development and the redefinition of customer segmentation. Resulted in the creation of a customer-centric product roadmap and a strategic plan for business expansion.

-Product Planning: Fostered collaboration within the upstream product management team to customize and launch the "One Piece Asia Special Edition" watch in the Malaysia region, accelerating the sales of this special edition product even during the pandemic, with accurate demand planning.

-Forecasting and Supply Negotiation: In the face of a sharp decline in market demand during the pandemic, I achieved sales goals by restructuring the product mix and persuading the supply owner to allocate production tailored to the Malaysian market and reduced the risk of slow-moving inventory. 

-Software Product Integration: Facilitated Garmin South East Asia e-commerce project with large cross-function teams to integrate local payment service with Adyen (payment service provider), local acquiring bank, and launched Vietnam and Thailand e-commerce store within 6 months.', 'title': 'Regional Product Manager at Korea & SEA', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}, {'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'company': 'Garmin', 'description': "-Downstream Product Management: Boosted newly established Garmin Korea's sales performance, achieved double-digit growth for three consecutive years and increased brand awareness in the region within one year. This was made possible by seamless transitions in product life cycles, optimizing demand planning for new and slow-moving products with data analysis. Implementing pricing strategies, promotions, and go-to-market plans.

-Roadmap Development: Developed Korea market product roadmap and reduced 50% of high risk of storing phased-out product inventory. 

-Change Management: Strengthened the operational efficiency of Garmin Korea by leading the implementation of customized Oracle ERP system. Transitioned all distributors from traditional email and phone call ordering to redesigned Order Portal within 2 months by leading the customized Distribution Order Portal project, significantly improved  the local ordering process, pricing accuracy, supply workflow, and demand planning.

-E-Commerce Store Integration: Launching Garmin Korea e-commerce Store Launching project within 6 months by coordinating cross-functional team resources including finance, customer service and development team. Engaged the local payment gateway KCP with our internal ERP system. 

-Data Transportation: By leading the Coupang (Korea's top e-commerce platform) Order Portal EDI project and designing an efficient order processing workflow, I was able to enhance distribution supply capabilities and  generate direct sales performance, contributing 5% to our overall sales.", 'title': 'Regional Product Manager', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}, {'location': 'Taipei', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'company': 'Garmin', 'description': "- Negotiation and Demand Fulfillment: As a newcomer, I swiftly analyzed past demand, forecasted future demand, and effectively communicated with stakeholders to understand local needs.
